articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Friendship Delegations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Friendship Delegations
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Tuesday received the Chinese friendship delegation led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, and the delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association headed by Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, on a visit to the DPRK to attend the celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there were Vice-Chairmen of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Jong Un and Ri Yong Ho, Member of the Political Bureau and Secretary of the WPK Central Committee Choe Thae Bok, Member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kang Sok Ju, Alternate Member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and Vice-Chairman of the NDC Jang Song Thaek, Alternate Members of the Political Bureau and Secretaries of the WPK Central Committee Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon, First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan and Chairman of the Joint Venture and Investment Committee Ri Su Yong.
					
					 The heads of the delegations presented gifts to Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 On the occasion Zhang Dejiang said it was a great event in the history of the bilateral relations that Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung signed the treaty on July 11, 1961 50 years ago. 
					
					 He paid highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who has made an undying contribution to steadily boosting the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 The Chinese party and government will steadfastly carry forward the baton of the traditional and special Sino-DPRK friendship and honestly implement the wide-ranging agreements reached between the top leaders of the two countries, he noted.
					
					 Welcoming the DPRK visit of the Chinese friendship delegations, Kim Jong Il said over the past half a century since the treaty was concluded the two parties and the two governments have supported and closely cooperated with each other in political, military, economic, cultural and other fields in the spirit of the treaty and powerfully demonstrated before the world the tremendous vitality of the DPRK-China friendship which remains unchanged no matter how much water flow under the bridge and no matter how frequently a generation is replaced by another. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner for the guests.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, Li Shenglin, minister of Transport, Wang Yulin, governor of the Jilin Provincial People's Government, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, the deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, the assistant to the Foreign Minister, Yang Yanyi, assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, and Jing Dunquan, vice-chairman of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries.
					
					 Present there were Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Choe Thae Bok, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Kye Gwan and Ri Su Yong.
					
					 The dinner proceeded in a friendly and amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Friendship Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Friendship Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C. of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met with the Chinese friendship delegation led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C. of the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday and had a friendly talk with it.
					 Zhang said Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung signed the Sino-DPRK treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance, laying a solid foundation for the steady development of the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 He reiterated his will to make positive efforts for the development of the Sino-DPRK relations, a legacy bequeathed by the revolutionaries of the elder generations of the two countries and the common treasure.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would register great successes in the building of a thriving country on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung under the leadership of the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Friendship Delegation Tours Various Parts of DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Friendship Delegation Tours Various Parts of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Chinese friendship delegation led by Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm Tuesday.
					 Being briefed on the farm the guests toured different places of the farm.
					
					 On the same day, the delegation toured the E-Library and the Indoor Swimming Pool at Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Comes Back from China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Comes Back from China
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK friendship delegation led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, returned home on Tuesday after visiting China at the invitation of its government to attend the commemorations of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Calls for High-level Visits and Exchange with DPRK
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Calls for High-level Visits and Exchange with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- I wish the Korean people, dear comrades and friends, greater successes under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Hu Jintao, president of China, said this when meeting the friendship delegation of the DPRK headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on a visit to China to attend the commemorations of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Monday.
					
					 He went on to say:
					
					 For the two countries to commemorate the anniversary by dispatching delegations is of important significance in boosting the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly relations.
					
					 The two countries have respected, supported and cooperated and steadily encouraged each other to boost the relations of friendship and cooperation in the spirit of the treaty for the past five decades.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited China several times, contributing to putting the Sino-DPRK friendship on a fresh stage of development.
					
					 It is the steadfast strategic line of the party and government of China to continue developing the said relations, he noted, expressing his will to boost, together with Korean comrades, high-level visits and exchange and expand economic trade and cooperation between both sides in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Underscores Need to Boost Sino-DPRK Relations
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Underscores Need to Boost Sino-DPRK Relations
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of Chinese National People's Congress, met with a friendship delegation headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, in the  Great Hall of the People, Beijing Monday and had a friendly talk with it.
					 Wu Bangguo said Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung signed the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance 50 years ago, laying a legal foundation for the development of Sino-DPRK relations.
					
					 The three visits paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to China in recent years testify to the fact that the bilateral relations have entered a fresh stage of development, he noted.
					
					 He reiterated his will to bring the Sino-DPRK relations to a higher level together with the Korean comrades.
					
					 Recalling that Kim Jong Il has provided field guidance to many units related to people's living including industry and agriculture this year, he expressed belief that the Korean people would make greater successes under his leadership.

articles.title: Reception Given at DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Beijing gave a reception on July 10 to mark the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were State Councilor Dai Bingguo, a vice-minister of Railways, Vice-Minister of Culture Zhao Shaohua and other officials concerned of China. 
					
					 On hand were the DPRK friendship delegation led by Vice-President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop, the delegation of the DPRK-China Friendship Association led by Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik and Ambassador Ji Jae Ryong and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Dai Bingguo said that the China-DPRK treaty signed by Premier Zhou Enlai and President Kim Il Sung on July 11, 1961, was a great event in the history of the bilateral relations.
					
					 Over the past 50 years both sides have trusted, supported and closely cooperated with each other in the spirit of the treaty, thus promoting the steady development of the bilateral relations and positively contributing to regional peace and stability, he noted.
					
					 In recent years the China-DPRK relations have made steady and fresh progress thanks to the warm care of the top leaders of the two countries and the joint efforts of both sides, he said.
					
					 It is the fixed strategic policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily boost the traditional China-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation, he said, adding: The Chinese people will, together with the Korean people, carry into practice the important common understandings, reached by the top leaders of the two countries, in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation.
					
					 He stressed the need to reenergize mutual visit of personnel of the two countries, intensify the strategic mutual understanding and deepen technical and multilateral cooperation to put the China-DPRK relations onto a higher stage. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a photo exhibition and a reception took place at the DPRK Consulate General in Shenyang on July 9.

articles.title: Chinese Consul-General to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Consul-General to DPRK Gives Reception 
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Dong Minjie, consul-general of China to Chongjin of the DPRK, hosted a reception at Chonmasan Hotel Monday to mark the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Sun Sok, secretary general of the North Hamgyong Provincial People's Committee, officials of local party and power bodies and officials concerned. 
					
					 Staff members of the consulate general and Chinese residents in Chongjin were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Russian President Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev as regards the casualties of a passenger ship sinking that was caused by heavy rainfall and storm in the Tatarstan Republic of the Russian Federation.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president of Russia and, through him, to the bereaved families and victims.

articles.title: Greeting to Sao Tome and Principe President
articles.content:
Greeting to Sao Tome and Principe President
						
Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Frederique de Menezes, president of Sao Tome and Principe, Tuesday on the 36th anniversary of the proclamation of its independence and Republic.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Officials Visit Fruit Farms
articles.content:
Officials Visit Fruit Farms
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions of the DPRK Monday visited the Ryongjon and Toksong fruit farms in South Hamgyong Province.
					 Officials and employees of the farms built big orchards by their own efforts and made signal successes through a vigorous drive to put them on a modern and scientific basis.
					
					 On the Ryongjon Fruit Farm, the visitors toured the Ryongjon Revolutionary Museum and enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the farm at the observatory. The farm shows such sceneries as sea of fruits and cosy modern dwelling-houses, welfare facilities and fruit stores located at the foot of a mountain.
					
					 On the Toksong Fruit Farm they toured a room devoted to its history, newly-built orchard, the youth workteam and other places.

articles.title: Japanese Calls for Improved DPRK-Japan Ties
articles.content:
Japanese Calls for Improved DPRK-Japan Ties 
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Hiroji Nakagawa, head of the Japanese delegation of the Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, had an interview with KCNA at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Monday before returning home.
					 We were struck with admiration at the reality of the DPRK, he said, adding: 
					
					 During the visit we toured the E-Library of Kim Il Sung University, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, the Ostrich Farm in the suburbs of Pyongyang and other places.
					
					 This visit made us deeply feel that everything serves the people in the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people are striving to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation, true to the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 We extend greetings to them dynamically advancing full of confidence. 
					
					 We heartily hope that Kim Jong Il will enjoy good health and the DPRK further prosper. 
					
					 We are grateful for the relief fund the DPRK offered Japan over the massive quake and tsunami this year that claimed great human and material losses. 
					
					 Referring to the fact that the Japanese government does not work for peace in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula, he further said: 
					
					 The Japanese government seeks only sanctions on the DPRK. 
					
					 It should take concrete steps to improve the relations between the two countries with proper judgment on the situation. 
					
					 Only then, is it possible to ensure the relationship of confidence between the two countries, I believe.

articles.title: Servicepersons and People Meet to Condemn Lee Myung Bak Group's Crimes
articles.content:
Servicepersons and People Meet to Condemn Lee Myung Bak Group's Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies and meetings took place in cities, counties, industrial establishments, farms and universities to denounce the crimes of the Lee Myung Bak group of unparalleled traitors.
					Present there were servicepersons, officials of local party and power bodies, public organizations, institutions at various levels and industrial establishments, farms and universities, working people and students.
					
					 The statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army was read out there before speeches were made. 
					
					 The speakers branded the Lee group as fanatics and gangsters keen on confrontation with fellow countrymen as it has stoked hostility towards the DPRK since the very day it came to power. 
					
					 They expressed their firm will to react to the provocations of the group with a stern punishment and a war with a merciless retaliatory one. 
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will always emerge victorious as long as they are single-mindedly united around General Secretary Kim Jong Il and have matchless military muscle, they stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Effort for Recovering from Typhoon Damage
articles.content:
DPRK's Effort for Recovering from Typhoon Damage
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A nationwide effort has been launched in the DPRK to recover from damage caused by a recent typhoon.
					 Most areas of the DPRK were affected by typhoon-5 for three days from June 25.
					
					The typhoon brought a strong wind, heavy rain and tidal wave to the DPRK, claiming casualties and leaving more than 160 dwelling blocks destroyed and over 21,000 hectares of cultivated areas submerged, washed away and buried mainly in west coastal areas.
					
					 Public buildings, production facilities, roads and river banks were wrecked or inundated.
					
					 Kangwon, North and South Hwanghae Provinces and other affected areas are now working on securing materials needed for the reconstruction work. 
					
					 They are rebuilding damaged dwelling houses, public buildings, roads and bridges to stabilize inhabitants' living.
					
					 They are also draining flooded cropland, clearing out ditches and embanking rivers.

articles.title: History Book Tongsagangmok
articles.content:
History Book Tongsagangmok 
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Tongsagangmok is an old book dealing with the history ranging from Ancient Korea (early 30th century B.C.-108 B.C.) to the end of Koryo kingdom (918-1392). 
					 An Jong Bok, a realist scholar (1712-1791), compiled the book in 1778, on the basis of many local and foreign history books. 
					
					 The book contains a posthumous article of Ri Ik, another realist scholar (1681-1763), introduction, table of contents, explanatory notes, histories of successive dynasties, geographical features and government posts.    
					
					 It, richer than other history books in materials, gives explanations of the Korean people's struggle against invasions, astronomy, architecture, metallurgy, culture, politics, land and slavery.   
					
					 Tongsagangmok has an appendix with the author's views of historical events and comments on folktales.  
					
					 The book is considered one of the nation's heritages as it is of weighty significance in studying the historical development of Korea.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (9)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (9)
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Head of a workteam of the Tongbong Cooperative Farm, Hamju County Mun Kum Nyo is one of ardent patriots upholding the Workers' Party of Korea with increased grain production. She is a meritorious person in the Songun era.
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the farm in February Juche 98 (2009) and met her who worked hard as head of a workteam for decades. He called her a revolutionary in the countryside, who was firmly defending the rural position, and showed solicitude for her.
					
					 Always remembering the glorious days when President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il visited the farm, she did well double and treble cropping as taught by Kim Jong Il, actively introduced advanced farming methods and technology and set an example in raising per-hectare yield in paddy and non-paddy fields despite the unfavorable weather conditions in the eastern coastal areas.
					
					 She, nearing 70, is working hard to do farming well this year with the enthusiasm to glorify the honor of being a revolutionary in the rural area till the last moments of her life.
					
					 Steadfast is the socialist rural position of the DPRK thanks to the patriots who are devoting all their sweats and enthusiasm to the land in order to increase grain production to realize Kim Jong Il's plan for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercise under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercise under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the United States and the south Korean puppet military warmongers staged a "joint scientific exercise." Involved in the exercise were aggressor forces including reconnaissance drones, long-range radars and laser guided devices of the 2nd Division of the U.S. forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The exercise, the first of its kind staged in the area along the Military Demarcation Line, was reckless saber-rattling aimed to ignite another Korean war at any cost in league with the south Korean puppet warmongers.
					
					 The aggressive and dangerous nature of the exercise found a vivid manifestation in that the 2nd Division played a main role in the military exercise. 
					
					 This division is busy with exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK while massively introducing war equipment based on the ultra-modern science and technology. 
					
					 What merited a serious attention at home and abroad was that the maneuver was watched by the commander of the 8th U.S. Army in south Korea. 
					
					 The 8th U.S. Army had already been reorganized as a field army. 
					
					 The above-said fact clearly suggests that the recent saber-rattling was designed to examine a military operation for preemptive attack on the DPRK. 
					
					 It is the immediate scenario of the U.S. to threaten and blackmail the Korean people by force of arms in an effort to disturb their building of a thriving socialist country. 
					
					 Due to the U.S. imperialists the military tension is escalating and the danger of war growing on the Korean Peninsula with each passing day, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Blasted
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The provocations committed by the south Korean puppet military warmongers against the DPRK were neither individual acts nor accidental but natural products of the Lee Myung Bak conservative regime's policy of confrontation with the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The provocations committed by south Korea were perpetrated by the Lee group extremely hostile towards compatriots and prompted by its evermore undisguised moves to escalate the confrontation of systems. 
					
					 What bitterness the group has towards compatriots is clearly evidenced by the fact that it set it as a major policy goal to stoke hostility towards fellow countrymen among south Koreans, talking about overall "reexamination" of its "education for unification and security". 
					
					 The group has gone mad with confrontation of systems, openly negating the dignified socialist system in the DPRK. It has now gone the lengths of malignantly hurting the dignity of the leadership of the DPRK and its system. But the fellow countrymen will surely force the group to pay for all crimes it has committed against the country and nation in a bid to win in the confrontation of systems. 
					
					 Now that neither dialogue nor cooperation is possible, there remains in the north-south relations only the return of fire for fire.
					
					 As the puppet forces made such provocative remarks as not ruling out even a war against the DPRK, its army will react to provocations with punishment and a war with merciless sacred retaliatory war. 
					
					 The group's policy of confrontation with the DPRK will only precipitate its ruin, warns the article.

articles.title: Reinstatement of Fired Teachers Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Reinstatement of Fired Teachers Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Branch of the south Korean Teachers Union held a rally on July 7 demanding the reinstatement of union members laid off for no ground.
					 At the rally speakers charged that the education authorities have not yet honored the promise to reinstate the dismissed teachers while reading the face of the "government" conservative camp. 
					
					 The education authorities should immediately implement the promise they made with the people, they urged.
					
					 Earlier, teachers affiliated with the Union started demonstrations and sit-in strikes in demand of reinstatement of dismissed teachers on June 28.

articles.title: S. Korean Security Authorities' Suppression of Pro-reunification Forces Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Security Authorities' Suppression of Pro-reunification Forces Censured
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on July 8 issued a statement denouncing the puppet security authorities for their fascist suppression of pro-reunification activists.
					 The Intelligence Service and the police on July 6 carried out a search operation against the houses of An Jae Gu, former professor at Kyongbuk National University, and his son, the statement recalled.
					
					 It condemned the authorities for cracking down on their legitimate reunification movement after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration by labeling it as illegal.
					
					 The repressive campaign kicked off by the group of traitors is aimed at bringing to naught at any cost the vitality of the joint declaration and achievements made by it, the statement charged.
					
					 It called upon all the people to turn out in the actions for foiling the fascist suppression and putting an end to the dictatorship by concerted efforts.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Intelligence Service Accused of Its Sinister Attempt
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Intelligence Service Accused of Its Sinister Attempt 
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Registration Fee Network on July 10 accused the puppet Intelligence Service of trying to crack down on the actions for the settlement of registration fee issue by linking them with the north, the south Korean MBC reported.
					 On July 9 the Intelligence Service mobilized dozens of its agents for a search operation against the "University Education Research Institute" in Seoul and they kicked up a racket, scouring even private handbooks, the organization noted.
					
					 It accused the Intelligence Service of suppressing a room chief of the institute on the baseless charge that he conducted activities at the "instructions of the north".
					
					 Lurking behind the suppression is an attempt of the IS to politicize the actions for the settlement of registration fee issue, it held.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Indiscriminate Suppression of Protestors
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Indiscriminate Suppression of Protestors
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police on July 10 indiscriminately suppressed members of civic and public organizations for their protest actions against the unreasonable lay-off, the south Korean MBC reported.
					 That day more than 3,000 members of civic and public organizations held a rally around the Young Do Shipbuilding Yard of the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd., demanding the management side cancel the lay-off.
					
					 The riot police fired water cannons and tear liquid at the protestors, leaving dozens of them wounded and walking off at least 40 others.

articles.title: Meeting of Activists of Chongryon Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Activists of Chongryon Held 
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting of activists of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo on Sunday. It was held to bring about a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					 Among those present at the meeting were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, and other officials and compatriots. 
					
					 A message of greetings to the participants in the meeting from the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was read out. 
					
					 Vice-Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon Nam Sung U made a report which was followed by speeches. 
					
					 The reporter said the meeting was aimed to generalize the successes and experience gained in the "90-day campaign" and surely lay a springboard for bringing about a fresh heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan in the significant 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Laying the springboard means consolidating the organizational and ideological base of Chongryon and conducting brisk national education, the lifeline of the movement of Koreans in Japan, work with the young Koreans who would carry forward the patriotic work generation after generation and work with people in commerce, a powerful engine for the work of Chongryon, and thus make the Korean community prosperous so that compatriots may enjoy happiness and have a bright future, he noted. 
					
					 He called upon all the officials and activists of Chongryon to unite single-mindedly around leader Kim Jong Il, feeling highly proud of being descendants of Kim Il Sung's nation, and emerge victors by providing the springboard for ushering in a fresh heyday in 2012 at any cost.
					
					 The meeting adopted a letter to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Then followed a reception. 
					
					 A photo exhibition on the meeting was held in the hall on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Polish Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Polish Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Poland-DPRK Association on July 5 posted on its Internet homepage photos of President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities and an article to commemorate the 17th anniversary of his demise.
					 The article titled "Kim Il Sung's Korea" elaborated on the fact that he founded the Juche idea, waged the armed struggle to liberate the country and wisely led the building of a new country after the national liberation, the Fatherland Liberation War, the postwar rehabilitation and construction and the building of socialism.
					
					 The Korean people are praising him as the "sun of Juche" and "father of the nation", it noted.
					
					 He successfully settled the continuity of leadership, thus providing a sure guarantee for the bright future of socialist Korea, the article said.
					
					The revolutionary cause of Juche started by him has been creditably carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the article said, adding he is leading the army and people of the DPRK to victory under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The august name of Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of the DPRK, will be cherished in the mind of mankind through centuries, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered by Personages of Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered by Personages of Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries have remembered President Kim Il Sung in humble reverence.
					 The director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute said the Koreans and other world progressive people are recalling in humble reverence the undying feats of the President who devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and global independence.
					
					 The general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia said that the Korean people are holding Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the founder of socialist Korea and the eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said that in the DPRK the country, the army and the most excellent and significant monuments were named after the word "people" thanks to the President.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said that the President led a simple life without distinction from the people and cast his lot with them, always finding himself among them during his lifetime.
					
					 The first vice-chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK said Kim Il Sung is the great master of politics, thinker-theoretician and practician none of the great persons in the world can match. The President is always alive as the sun in the hearts of not only the Koreans but also the world progressive people, he added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Ecuador
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People on July 5 brought out in e-book President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country".
					 This work, published on April 6, Juche 82 (1993), clarifies all ways for achieving great national unity.
					
					 The ways include matters of founding a unified state through unity of the whole nation and achieving the unity on the basis of patriotism and the spirit of national independence.
					
					 The work also deals with matters of promoting co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests, putting a halt to all political disputes inciting division and confrontation between fellow countrymen, achieving confidence and unity between the north and the south, refraining from rejecting each other because of differing ism and joining hands with each other on the road of national reunification.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated Abroad 
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries between July 3 and 5 to commemorate the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They included remembrance meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Russia, Guinea, South Africa, India and Austria.
					
					On display at their venues were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their exploits and books and photos introducing the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Dagestan Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia said that Kim Il Sung's was life dedicated to the freedom and independence of Korea and the happiness of its people.
					
					 His lifetime, a good example of devoted service to the nation and the socialist cause, greatly encourages many world people aspiring after independence against imperialism, the chairman said. 
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said the President is always alive as Kim Jong Il is creditably carrying on the President's cause with absolute loyalty to him.
					
					 The secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party who doubles as chairman of the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People said: Kim Il Sung is a great man as he devoted all his life only to the happiness and well-being of the people and performed great exploits for human cause of independence.
					
					 Korean Films shown included "The Country I Saw" and "The Tower of the Juche Idea".
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in India and Austria.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Malaysia
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A Malaysian preparatory committee was formed on July 5 to commemorate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The president of the Dombo Enterprise Company was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to conduct throughout the country various political and cultural events in praise of Kim Il Sung's greatness and exploits on the occasion of the anniversary.

articles.title: Brazilian Organization Introduces S. Korean People's Anti-"Government" Struggle
articles.content:
Brazilian Organization Introduces S. Korean People's Anti-"Government" Struggle 
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on July 3 posted on its Internet homepage an article introducing the south Korean people's anti-"government" struggle.
					 The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Seoul on June 29 in protest against the authorities' anti-worker policy, the article said, and went on:
					
					Speeches were made at the rally with more than 12,000 workers and students from across south Korea attending.
					
					  Speakers charged that the "government" and the Human Rights Committee have not taken any measure against violations of workers' rights.
					
					 They declared they would wage the anti-dictatorship struggle in different parts of south Korea to overthrow the Lee Myung Bak "government" insisting on the unreasonable suppression of workers and the pro-capital policy.
					
					 They stressed that they would continue the vigorous struggle for vital rights in solidarity with people from all walks of life and thus punish the Lee "government" without fail.

articles.title: Russian Prime Minister Calls for Establishing World-class Science Complexes
articles.content:
Russian Prime Minister Calls for Establishing World-class Science Complexes 
 Moscow, July 11 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin in his speech at a recent meeting called for establishing world-class science complexes in Russia.
					 Saying that Russia has all conditions for undertaking the work to set them up, he noted that such program would be equal to the space and nuclear one in its size.

articles.title: Russian Air Force Conducts Long-distance Patrol Flight
articles.content:
Russian Air Force Conducts Long-distance Patrol Flight
						
 Moscow, July 11 (KCNA) -- Two Tu-95MCs, strategic bombers of the long-distance flying corps of the Russian Air Force, successfully conducted patrol flight in the sky above the Pacific and neutral waters, according to a spokesman for the Air Force on July 8.
					 After taking off at the Ukrainka air-force base, the pilots of bombers practiced aviation in conditions hard to judge direction during the flight of about 11 hours.

articles.title: Netherlands's Interference in Internal Affairs of Russia Rejected
articles.content:
Netherlands's Interference in Internal Affairs of Russia Rejected
						
 Moscow, July 11 (KCNA) -- The Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs on July 5 accused Netherlands of its interfering in internal affairs of Russia. 
					 The Parliament of Netherlands recently supported the U.S. Congress' initiative to put sanctions on some Russian officials as regards the death of a lawyer during preliminary investigation in Russia.
					
					 The ministry branded this as Netherlands's interference in the internal affairs of Russia. 
					
					 Terming this behavior disregard of its concern for the investigation into a criminal case, the ministry made it clear that it is intolerable to attempt to punish someone whose offense has not been proved.

articles.title: Mayor of Nago City, Japan Demands US Military Base out of Prefecture
articles.content:
Mayor of Nago City, Japan Demands US Military Base out of Prefecture 
						
Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The mayor of Nago City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan strongly protested the recent government's agreement with the U.S. to transfer the U.S. Air Force Base in Futenma to Henoko, Nago City, when meeting with a vice-minister of Foreign Affairs on July 5.
					 The mayor said he cannot accept such a decision adopted indifferent to the view of the locals.
					
					 The Nago citizens are enraged at the government attitude, he said, demanding the base be transferred out of the prefecture.

articles.title: Palestinians Rebuff US House of Representatives' Warning
articles.content:
Palestinians Rebuff US House of Representatives' Warning
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Saeb Erekat, member of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, in a press interview on July 8 rebuffed the U.S. House of Representatives' warning.
					 The U.S. House of Representatives adopted a decision on July 7 to cut off aid if the Palestinian National Authority applies a written request on the recognition of an independent state to the United Nations in September.
					
					 "The decision is rejected, denounced and unjustified," he said.
					
					 "I don't believe that the U.S. decision would influence the Palestinian leadership's decision to apply to the UN," said Erekat.

articles.title: Afghans Protest Killing of Civilians by NATO Forces
articles.content:
Afghans Protest Killing of Civilians by NATO Forces
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of Afghans in Khost Province, Afghanistan on Thursday staged a protest against the killing of civilians by NATO-led troops. 
					 The protestors claimed that the NATO-led troops on Wednesday hit a civilian house, killing over a dozen civilians.
					
					 Chanting anti-NATO slogans in streets, the protestors strongly demanded the NATO military authorities punish those responsible for the killing of non-combatant citizens and stop at once air raid on residential quarters.

articles.title: Economy of Central African Region Expected to Grow
articles.content:
Economy of Central African Region Expected to Grow
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The economy of the Central African region is expected to grow at the rate of 5.2 percent in 2011 as compared to 4.3 percent in 2010.
					 These revelations were made on Wednesday by the governor of the Bank of the Central African States.

articles.title: 90th Anniversary of CPC Celebrated in Beijing
articles.content:
90th Anniversary of CPC Celebrated in Beijing
						
 Beijing, July 11 (KCNA) -- A meeting "Party Is in the Hearts of People" was held in Beijing on July 5 on the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China under the co-sponsorship of the Publicity Department of the CPC Central Committee, the Committee for Affairs of Institutions Directly under the Authority of the Centre, the Committee for Affairs of Central State Organs, the Ministry of Education, the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and the Beijing Municipal Committee of the CPC.
					 10 persons told the attendants about what they experienced and what they heard.

articles.title: New Books Off Press in China
articles.content:
New Books Off Press in China 
						
 Beijing, July 11 (KCNA) -- New books such as "Ideas of Mao Zedong in Chronological Order from 1921 to 1975", "Ideas of Deng Xiaoping in Chronological Order from 1975 to 1997", "Formation of Mao Zedong's Ideas and the Historical Period of Its Development" and "Formation of the System of Socialist Theory with Chinese Characteristics and Historical Period of Its Development from 1978 to 2011" were recently published in China on the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China. 
					 The books were edited by the Document Research Office of the Central Committee of the CPC and issued by the Central Documents' Publishing House.

articles.title: Natural Damage in China
articles.content:
Natural Damage in China
						
 Beijing, July 11 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains and hails hit various areas of China from July 1, causing damage.
					 According to the Office of the State Disaster Reduction Committee on July 8, 49 people were dead, 21 went missing and 307,000 were evacuated in 20 provinces.
					
					 The total number of the victims is 7,545,000 and the economic losses amount to 6,390 million RMB.Y.
					
					 Rescue steps are being taken in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A 5.6-magnitude earthquake hit Fukushima Prefecture, Japan on July 8.
					 The epicenter was in waters off the prefecture.

articles.title: 15 Killed in Japan Due to Swelter
articles.content:
15 Killed in Japan Due to Swelter
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Severe swelter persisting in Japan, caused 15 death, said the Ministry of Internal Affairs on July 5.  
					6,877 heatstroke cases broke out across the country in June this year, about three times the same month last year.

articles.title: Heavy Rains Hit S. Korea
articles.content:
Heavy Rains Hit S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains hit the southern parts of the Korean Peninsula, causing many casualties in south Korea, the south Korean KBS reported on July 11.
					 Landslides occurred and rivers overflowed in Sochon, South Chungchong Province, Posong and Ryosu, South Jolla Province, Wanju, North Jolla Province and other areas, leaving 13 persons dead and five missing.

articles.title: Passenger Plane Crashes in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Passenger Plane Crashes in Democratic Congo
						
Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A passenger plane crashed in Democratic Congo on July 8.
					 It crashed while landing at Kisangani Airport amid strong rainy wind.
					
					 The accident left 127 persons dead, said the Ministry of Transport of the country.
					
					 The government declared a three-day mourning in this regard.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se rene con delegacin de amistad de China
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se rene con delegacin de amistad de China
						
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ATCC) -- El miembro del Presidium del Bur Poltico del Comit Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Repblica Popular Democrtica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departi el da 12 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae en un ambiente amistoso con la delegacin de amistad de China encabezada por el miembro del Bur Poltico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Repblica Popular China, Zhang Dejiang, que le hizo una visita de cortesa.
					En la audiencia, Zhang dijo que el premier Zhou Enlai y el Presidente Kim Il Sung firmaron el tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacin y la ayuda mutua China-Corea preparando la base firme para seguir desarrollando la amistad China-Corea.
					
					Expuso la voluntad de trabajar activamente por  desarrollar la amistad China-Corea, legado de los revolucionarios de generacin veterana y patrimonio comn de ambos pases.
					
					Dese que bajo la direccin del PTC encabezado por su Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano logre grandes xitos en la construccin de la gran potencia prspera con motivo del centenario de nacimiento del Presidente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam enva mensaje de condolencias a Medvedev
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam enva mensaje de condolencias a Medvedev
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Repblica Popular Democrtica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envi el da 12 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente ruso, Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev, en relacin con que se produjo la prdida humana por el accidente de hundimiento del barco de pasajeros debido a la lluvia torrencial y la tempestad en la Repblica de Tatarstan de la Federacin Rusa.
					El remitente expresa una profunda compasin y condolencias al destinatario y por su conducto, a los familiares de difuntos y a las vctimas.

articles.title: Delegacin china recorre varios lugares
articles.content:
Delegacin china recorre varios lugares
						
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ATCC) -- La delegacin de amistad de China encabezada por el miembro del Bur Poltico del Comit Central del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Repblica Popular China, Zhang Dejiang, visitaron este martes la Granja Frutcola Combinada Taedonggang.
					Los huspedes chinos recorrieron varios lugares escuchando explicaciones.
					
					El mismo da, la delegacin pas por la Biblioteca Electrnica, el centro de piscinas, etc. de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Personalidad japonesa se refiere a la mejora de relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Personalidad japonesa se refiere a la mejora de relaciones con Corea 
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ATCC) -- Hiroji Nakagawa, jefe de la delegacin del Consejo de los Habitantes del Departamento de Nagano, Japn, de Apoyo a la Reunificacin Independiente y Pacfica de Corea, se reuni el da 11 en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang con un reportero de la ATCC, antes de regresar a su patria.
					Me qued emocionado al ver con mis ojos la realidad de Corea, dijo y continu:
					
					Durante mi estancia aqu, recorr la Biblioteca Electrnica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, la Granja Frutcola Combinada Taedonggang, la Granja de Avestruz en el suburbio de la ciudad de Pyongyang y otros varios lugares, donde sent profundamente que en Corea todo sirve para el pueblo. 
					
					En fiel acato a la gua del estimado Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano libra activamente la lucha por abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prspera. 
					
					Hago llegar mi saludo al pueblo coreano que avanza a pasos firmes con la fe en la victoria. 
					
					Deseo de todo corazn buena salud al estimado Secretario General Kim Jong Il, y la prosperidad a la Repblica Popular Democrtica de Corea. 
					
					Nos agradecemos de que este ao Corea haya enviado fondos de consuelo a nuestro pas que sufri muchas prdidas humanas y materiales por el gran terremoto y tsunami. 
					
					El gobierno japons no hace esfuerzos por la paz del Nordeste Asitico y de la Pennsula Coreana, sino aplica sanciones contra Corea. 
					
					El gobierno japons debe tomar las medidas concretas para la mejora de las relaciones entre los dos pases con el juicio correcto sobre la situacin. 
					
					Estoy seguro de que slo de esta manera se prepararn las relaciones de confianza entre ambos pases.

articles.title: Continan mtines de militares y civiles contra la banda traidora
articles.content:
Continan mtines de militares y civiles contra la banda traidora
Pyongyang, 12 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar los mtines de los militares y los civiles en distintas ciudades, distritos, fbricas, empresas, granjas y universidades para condenar los crmenes de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak nunca visto en la historia. 
					Asistieron los oficiales y soldados del Ejrcito Popular de Corea, los funcionarios de los organismos locales del partido y el poder, entidades sociales, instituciones, empresas, fbricas, granjas y universidades a todos niveles, trabajadores, jvenes y estudiantes. 
					
					En los actos se dio lectura a la declaracin del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del EPC y hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores calificaron de manacos de guerra fratricida y de gangsteriles a los compinches de la horda traidora que desde los primeros das de su llegada al poder persigui la hostilidad anti-RPDC. 
					
					Expresaron la firme decisin de responder a la provocacin de la banda traidora con el castigo rotundo y a la guerra con la de represalia despiadada. 
					
					Concluyeron que lograrn victoria tras victoria el ejrcito y el pueblo coreanos que tienen la unidad monoltica en torno al Dirigente y el inagotable podero militar.
